verses.text_plain: After these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself.
verses.verse_html:
1After these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself. ▼
▼ to win…: Heb. to break them up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to win…: Heb. to break them up
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to win…: Heb. to break them up

verses.text_plain: And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem,
verses.verse_html:
2And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem, ▼
▼ he was…: Heb. his face was to war

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he was…: Heb. his face was to war
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he was…: Heb. his face was to war

verses.text_plain: He took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were without the city: and they did help him.
verses.verse_html: 3He took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were without the city: and they did help him.

verses.text_plain: So there was gathered much people together, who stopped all the fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?
verses.verse_html:
4So there was gathered much people together, who stopped all the fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water? ▼
▼ ran: Heb. overflowed

verses.text_plain: Also he strengthened himself, and built up all the wall that was broken, and raised it up to the towers, and another wall without, and repaired Millo in the city of David, and made darts and shields in abundance.
verses.verse_html:
5Also he strengthened himself, and built up all the wall that was broken, and raised it up to the towers, and another wall without, and repaired Millo in the city of David, and made darts and shields in abundance. ▼
▼ darts: or, swords, or, weapons

footnotes.body_html: ▼ darts: or, swords, or, weapons

verses.text_plain: And he set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the street of the gate of the city, and spake comfortably to them, saying,
verses.verse_html:
6And he set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the street of the gate of the city, and spake comfortably to them, saying, ▼
▼ spake…: Heb. he spoke to their heart

footnotes.body_text: ▼ spake…: Heb. he spoke to their heart
footnotes.body_html: ▼ spake…: Heb. he spoke to their heart

verses.text_plain: Be strong and courageous, be not afraid nor dismayed for the king of Assyria, nor for all the multitude that is with him: for there be more with us than with him:
verses.verse_html: 7Be strong and courageous, be not afraid nor dismayed for the king of Assyria, nor for all the multitude that is with him: for there be more with us than with him:

verses.text_plain: With him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the Lord our God to help us, and to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
verses.verse_html:
8With him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the Lord our God to help us, and to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah. ▼
▼ rested…: Heb. leaned

verses.text_plain: After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he himself laid siege against Lachish, and all his power with him,) unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying,
verses.verse_html:
9After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he himself laid siege against Lachish, and all his power with him,) unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying, ▼
▼ power: Heb. dominion

verses.text_plain: Thus saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide in the siege in Jerusalem?
verses.verse_html:
10Thus saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide in the siege in Jerusalem? ▼
▼ siege: or, strong hold

footnotes.body_html: ▼ siege: or, strong hold

verses.text_plain: Doth not Hezekiah persuade you to give over yourselves to die by famine and by thirst, saying, The Lord our God shall deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.verse_html: 11Doth not Hezekiah persuade you to give over yourselves to die by famine and by thirst, saying, The Lord our God shall deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

verses.text_plain: Hath not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and burn incense upon it?
verses.verse_html: 12Hath not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and burn incense upon it?

verses.text_plain: Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the people of other lands? were the gods of the nations of those lands any ways able to deliver their lands out of mine hand?
verses.verse_html: 13Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the people of other lands? were the gods of the nations of those lands any ways able to deliver their lands out of mine hand?

tokens.text: ye not what I and my fathers

verses.text_plain: Who was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand?
verses.verse_html: 14Who was there among all the gods of those nations that my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of mine hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of mine hand?

verses.text_plain: Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you on this manner, neither yet believe him: for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of mine hand, and out of the hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hand?
verses.verse_html: 15Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you on this manner, neither yet believe him: for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of mine hand, and out of the hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hand?

tokens.text: you on this manner, neither yet believe
how much less shall your God

verses.text_plain: And his servants spake yet more against the Lord God, and against his servant Hezekiah.
verses.verse_html: 16And his servants spake yet more against the Lord God, and against his servant Hezekiah.

verses.text_plain: He wrote also letters to rail on the Lord God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of other lands have not delivered their people out of mine hand, so shall not the God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of mine hand.
verses.verse_html: 17He wrote also letters to rail on the Lord God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of other lands have not delivered their people out of mine hand, so shall not the God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of mine hand.

verses.text_plain: Then they cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ speech unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.
verses.verse_html: 18Then they cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ speech unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.

verses.text_plain: And they spake against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the earth, which were the work of the hands of man.
verses.verse_html: 19And they spake against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the earth, which were the work of the hands of man.

verses.text_plain: And for this cause Hezekiah the king, and the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz, prayed and cried to heaven.
verses.verse_html: 20And for this cause Hezekiah the king, and the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz, prayed and cried to heaven.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord sent an angel, which cut off all the mighty men of valour, and the leaders and captains in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into the house of his god, they that came forth of his own bowels slew him there with the sword.
verses.verse_html:
21And the Lord sent an angel, which cut off all the mighty men of valour, and the leaders and captains in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into the house of his god, they that came forth of his own bowels slew him there with the sword. ▼
▼ slew…: Heb. made him fall

footnotes.body_html: ▼ slew…: Heb. made him fall

verses.text_plain: Thus the Lord saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all other, and guided them on every side.
verses.verse_html: 22Thus the Lord saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all other, and guided them on every side.

verses.text_plain: And many brought gifts unto the Lord to Jerusalem, and presents to Hezekiah king of Judah: so that he was magnified in the sight of all nations from thenceforth.
verses.verse_html:
23And many brought gifts unto the Lord to Jerusalem, and presents to Hezekiah king of Judah: so that he was magnified in the sight of all nations from thenceforth. ▼
▼ presents: Heb. precious things

footnotes.body_html: ▼ presents: Heb. precious things

verses.text_plain: In those days Hezekiah was sick to the death, and prayed unto the Lord: and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign.
verses.verse_html:
24In those days Hezekiah was sick to the death, and prayed unto the Lord: and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign. ▼
▼ gave…: or, wrought a miracle for him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ gave…: or, wrought a miracle for him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ gave…: or, wrought a miracle for him

verses.text_plain: But Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 25But Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of the Lord came not upon them in the days of Hezekiah.
verses.verse_html:
26Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of the Lord came not upon them in the days of Hezekiah. ▼
▼ pride: Heb. lifting up

tokens.text: not upon them in the days

footnotes.body_html: ▼ pride: Heb. lifting up

verses.text_plain: And Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant jewels;
verses.verse_html:
27And Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant jewels; ▼
▼ pleasant…: Heb. instruments of desire

tokens.text: and for all manner of pleasant

footnotes.body_html: ▼ pleasant…: Heb. instruments of desire

verses.text_plain: Storehouses also for the increase of corn, and wine, and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and cotes for flocks.
verses.verse_html: 28Storehouses also for the increase of corn, and wine, and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and cotes for flocks.

verses.text_plain: Moreover he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance: for God had given him substance very much.
verses.verse_html: 29Moreover he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance: for God had given him substance very much.

verses.text_plain: This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.
verses.verse_html: 30This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.

verses.text_plain: Howbeit in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to enquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.
verses.verse_html:
31Howbeit in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to enquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart. ▼
▼ ambassadors: Heb. interpreters

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.verse_html:
32Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his goodness, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel. ▼
▼ goodness: Heb. kindnesses

verses.text_plain: And Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the chiefest of the sepulchres of the sons of David: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html:
33And Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the chiefest of the sepulchres of the sons of David: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead. ▼
▼ chiefest: or, highest
